Artefact.Name: Sword of Striking
Artefact.Description: +1 to Hit

Artefact.Name: Sword of Battle
Artefact.Description: +1 Attack

Artefact.Name: Sword of Might
Artefact.Description: +1 Strenght

Artefact.Name: Biting Blade
Artefact.Description: -1 Armour save

Artefact.Name: Enchanted shield
Artefact.Description: 5+ Armour save

Artefact.Name: Talisman of Protection
Artefact.Description: 6+ Ward save

Artefact.Name: Staff of Sorcery
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: +1 to dispell
Artefact.Description: +1 to dispell

Artefact.Name: Dispell Scroll
Artefact.Description: automatically dispel an enemy spell, one use only

Artefact.Name: Power Stone
Artefact.Description: +2 dice to cast a spell

Artefact.Name: War Banner
Artefact.Description: +1 Combat Resolution

Artefact.Name: The Silver Lance of the Blessed
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: If the model has the Blessing of the Lady, then all attacks with the Silver Lance Of the Blessed automatically hit
Artefact.Description: The bearer has +2 Strength on the charge when mounted. If the model has the Blessing of the Lady, then all attacks with the Silver Lance Of the Blessed automatically hit.

Artefact.Name: Sword of the Quest
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: May be used a hand weapon or a great weapon, decided at the start of combat as normal
Artefact.Description: May be used as either a hand weapon or a great weapon, decided at the start of combat as normal. No Armour saves may be taken against the Sword of the Quest.

Artefact.Name: Sword of the Lady's Champion
Artefact.Description: The character always counts their Strength as one higher than their target's Toughness, unless their Strength would normally be more than this. In effect this means that they will always wound opponents on at least a 3+. This modified Strength is also used to calculate Armour save modifiers.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Heroes
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: +1 Strength and D3 wounds against enemies that have Toughness 5 or greater
Artefact.Description: Against enemies that have Toughness 5 or greater, the bearer gets +1 Strength and each unsaved wound caused by the Sword of Heroes becomes D3 wounds rather than 1.

Artefact.Name: The Heartwood Lance
Artefact.Description: The bearer has +2 Strength on the charge when mounted. The Heartwood Lance allows the bearer to re-roll all failed rolls to wound.

Artefact.Name: Birth-sword of Carcassonne
Artefact.Description: The sword acids +1 Strength to the bearer. Enemies wounded by the sword must re-roll any successful Armour saves.

Artefact.Name: Morning Star of Fracasse
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: For each hit on a close combat opponent, roll a D6. On a 4+, if the opponent has a magic weapon, it is destroyed
Artefact.Description: The bearer has +2 Strength in the first round of combat. For each hit on a close combat opponent, roll a D6. On a 4+, if the opponent has a magic weapon, it is destroyed.

Artefact.Name: The Lance of Artois
Artefact.Description: The bearer has +2 Strength on the charge when mounted. In addition, the lance confers the Killing Blow special rule onto the bearer, but only on turns during which the character charges.

Artefact.Name: The Wyrmlance
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Flaming attacks
Once per game, may make a breath attack from the tip of the lance at Strength 3 provided he is not in close combat
Artefact.Description: The bearer has +2 Strength on the charge when mounted. In addition, once per game, the model wielding the Wyrmlance may make a breath attack from the tip of the lance at Strength 3 provided he is not in close combat. Furthermore, all attacks made by the Wyrmlance count as flaming attacks.

Artefact.Name: Gilded Cuirass
Artefact.Description: Character with the Grail Vow only. This armour replaces the Knight's heavy armour, and gives a 5+ Armour save that can be combined with other equipment as normal. In addition, the wearer has Regeneration.

Artefact.Name: Armour of the Midsummer Sun
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Opponents suffer a -1 penalty to all rolls to hit the wearer and his mount with missile weapons and in close combat
Artefact.Description: This armour replaces the Knight's heavy armour, and gives a 5+ Armour save that may be combined with other armour as normal. Opponents suffer a -1 penalty to all rolls to hit the wearer and his mount with missile weapons and in close combat.

Artefact.Name: The Grail Shield
Artefact.Description: The shield provides a 6+ Armour save which may be combined with other armour as normal. The bearer's Ward save gained from the Blessing of the Lady is increased to 4+ against attacks of any Strength. If the model loses the Blessing, they lose this Ward save as normal.

Artefact.Name: Gromril Great Helm
Artefact.Description: Gives a 6+ Armour save and may be worn in addition to normal armour. The wearer may re-roll failed Armour saves.

Artefact.Name: Armour of Agilulf
Artefact.Description: This armour replaces the Knight's heavy armour and includes a shield, giving a 4+ Armour save. The shield must be used at all times - so the wearer cannot use a weapon that requires two hands. In addition, the armour confers Weapon Skill 10 (which cannot be altered with other items. Virtues, etc) to whoever is wearing it.

Artefact.Name: Cuirass of Fortune
Artefact.Description: This armour replaces the Knight's heavy armour, and gives a 5+ Annour save which may be combined with other armour as normal. When rolling to wound in close combat, the Knight may re-roll any dice rolls of 1.

Artefact.Name: Orcbane Shield
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Any unengaged Ore or Goblin unit within 12" that must take an Animosity test fails it on a 1-2 instead of a 1
Artefact.Description: Gives a 6+ Armour save and may be combined with other armour as normal. Any unengaged Ore or Goblin unit within 12" that must take an Animosity test fails it on a 1-2 instead of a 1.

Artefact.Name: Sirienne's Locket
Artefact.Description: A Knight with Sirienne's Locket can never suffer more than one-wound in any one phase from non-magical attacks - even multiple wound weapons (including war machines) can only cause a single wound. After the first wound in that phase is suffered, all subsequent wounds suffered during that phase are ignored. The bearer can still be run down by pursuing enemies as normal, and may still be affected as normal by Killing Blow.

Artefact.Name: Token of the Damsel
Artefact.Description: Against the first wounding hit suffered, the Knight gains a 2+ Ward save

Artefact.Name: Insignia of the Quest
Artefact.Description: If the hearer is ever reduced to 1 Wound, then the Knight instantly gains a 3+ Ward save. If the character suffers multiple wounds that would kill him hefore he has gained this Ward save (eg, if he has more than one wound left and is hit by a cannon ball), he will be reduced to 1 Wound, then may attempt his 3+ Ward save to stay alive and nullify any further wounds caused by the same hit.

Artefact.Name: Braid of Bordeleaux
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: One use only: until the beginning of the next Bretonnian turn, the character's Leadership value is increased by 1
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Braid may be used at the start of any Bretonnian turn. Until the beginning of the next Bretonnian turn, the character's Leadership value is increased by 1. In addition, once the Braid has been used, until the start of the next Bretonnian turn, the model bearing the Braid and any unit he is with can move over marsh, rivers, lakes or any other water features without penalty and will benefit from soft cover while in such terrain.

Artefact.Name: Dragon's Claw
Artefact.Description: The bearer's Ward save gained from the Blessing of the Lady is increased to 5+ against attacks of any Strength. If the model loses the Blessing, then it loses this Ward save as normal. In addition, as long as the bearer has the Blessing, he is immune to lire based attacks (such as Dragon's breath. Warp-fire Throwers and spells from the Lore of Fire).

Artefact.Name: Mantle of Damsel Elena
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Poisoned attacks do not wound automatically
Artefact.Description: Poisoned attacks do not wound automatically against a character with the Mantle. In addition, the special rules for Killing Blow-have no effect on the character.

Artefact.Name: Falcon-horn of Fredemund
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Until the start of the next Bretonnian turn, no enemy unit may fly, one use only
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Horn may he sounded at the start of any Bretonnian turn. Until the start of the next Bretonnian turn, no enemy unit may fly - they are forced to use their ground movement. Note that this may also alter the enemies flee/pursuit distance.

Artefact.Name: Holy Icon
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Magic Resistance (3)
Artefact.Description: The Holy Icon gives the character Magic Resistance (3).

Artefact.Name: The Ruby Goblet
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: This magic item will start to take effect at the end of the first phase during which the bearer or his unit suffers an unsaved wound; from that moment on, the bearer (and any unit he is with) cannot be wounded on better than a 3+ from any non-magical source
Artefact.Description: This magic item will start to take effect at the end of the first phase during which the bearer or his unit suffers an unsaved wound. From that moment on, the bearer (and any unit he is with) cannot be wounded on better than a 3+ from any non-magical source.

Artefact.Name: The Mane of the Purebreed
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: +1 Strength to the character's Warhorse and those of any unit he is with the first time they charge
Artefact.Description: Character on Warhorse only. The Mane confers +1 Strength to the character's Warhorse and those of any unit he is with the first time they charge.

Artefact.Name: Antlers of the Great Hunt
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: The Knight (and any unit he is with) may roll an additional dice when pursuing and choose the highest three (two if on foot)
Artefact.Description: The Knight (and any unit he is with) may roll an additional dice when pursuing and choose the highest three (two if on foot).

Artefact.Name: Tress of Isoulde
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Nominate one enemy model at the beginning of any Close Combat phase: the bearer hits that model on a 2+ for that Close Combat round, regardless of other modifiers
Artefact.Description: Nominate one enemy model at the beginning of any Close Combat phase. The bearer hits that model on a 2+ for that Close Combat round, regardless of other modifiers.

Artefact.Name: Gauntlet of the Duel
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Any challenge issued cannot be refused
Artefact.Description: Any challenge issued by the bearer of the Gauntlet of the Duel cannot be refused.

Artefact.Name: The Silver Mirror
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: May be used with the exact same effects as a Dispel Scroll, in addition, the enemy Wizard who cast the spell suffers an immediate Strength 6 hit, one use only
Artefact.Description: One use only. May be used with the exact same effects as a Dispel Scroll. In addition, the enemy Wizard who cast the spell suffers an immediate Strength 6 hit.

Artefact.Name: Sacrament of the Lady
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: At the start of any Bretonnian Magic phase, the hearer may use the Sacrament: the model generates double its usual number of Power dice, but may not cast any spells that turn, each time the Sacramente are used, roll a dice: on a 1 the model has run out of wafers and after that turn the Sacrament cannot be used for the remainder of the game
Artefact.Description: At the start of any Bretonnian Magic phase, the hearer may use the Sacrament. The model generates double its usual number of Power dice, but may not cast any spells that turn. Each time the Sacramente are used, roll a dice. On a 1 the model has run out of wafers and after that turn the Sacrament cannot be used for the remainder of the game.

Option.Name: Questing Vow
Option.SpecialRuleDescription: May re-roll any failed Psychology tests

Option.Name: Grail Vow
Option.SpecialRuleDescription: 5+ Ward save versus attacks with Strength 5 or higher

Option.Name: Questing Vow
Option.SpecialRuleDescription: May re-roll any failed Psychology tests

Option.Name: Grail Vow
Option.SpecialRuleDescription: 5+ Ward save versus attacks with Strength 5 or higher

Special.SpecialRuleDescription: After charges have been declared, if unit did not declare a charge but are within charge range of an enemy, then they must take a Leadership test to restrain themselves from charging; if this test is failed, they are forced to charge; if the test is passed, they may move normally; in addition, so reckless are the Knights Errant, that whenever they charge, the unit and any characters that have joined them are Immune to Psychology for the rest of that turn
May use the Leadership of any non-fleeing Knight within 6" of them; unit Standards do not confer any additional Victory Points if they are captured
May use the Leadership of any non-fleeing Knight within 6" of them; unit Standards do not confer any additional Victory Points if they are captured
No unit gains any charge bonus when they charge the unit's front
May re-roll any failed Psychology tests
May use the Leadership of any non-fleeing Knight within 6" of them; unit Standards do not confer any additional Victory Points if they are captured
5+ Ward save versus attacks with Strength 5 or higher
Every model in a unit of Grail Knights can issue and accept challenges as if they were a Champion
May use the Leadership of any non-fleeing Knight within 6" of them; unit Standards do not confer any additional Victory Points if they are captured
